Figure Caption: Microstructure of the as-prepared Al0.1CoCrFeNi HEA. (a) SEM-EBSD image. (b) XRD pattern showing the single phase FCC structure. (c) Selected area electron diffraction pattern taken from the <200>fccincidence direction. (d) Convergent beam electron diffraction from the <111>fccdirection showing the6 mmsymmetry of the FCC structure.

(a) Reconstructed atom maps of Fe, Cr, Co, Ni and Al by atom probe tomography; (b) Concentration line profiles projected from the marked cubiod region; and (c) Frequency distribution analysis of the atom probe dataset revealing the homogeneous nature of atom distribution.

Mechanical properties of the as-prepared Al0.1CoCrFeNi HEA. (a) Engineering and true strain-stress curves of the Al0.1CoCrFeNi HEA. (b) Work hardening rate derived from the fitted true strain-stress curve in (a).

Two-beam BF-STEM images of dislocations in the deformed alloy. (a) Deformation dislocations imaged at a 111-type diffraction operation. (b) The changes of dislocation core widths of the dissociated dislocations with dislocation character angles along the curved dislocation line. The inserted diffraction pattern shows the diffraction vector of the two-beam image condition. The intensity profile displays the method to determine the dislocation core width.(c)A dissociated dislocation with a narrow core width (∼10 nm) and small character angle (3°).(d)Lomer-Cottrell (LC) junctions (one marked by a arrow) formed on two {111} slip plane intersections.(e)A zoom-in view of one LC junction in(d). The partial dislocations are denoted by P.

(a) Weak beam dark field TEM image of dislocations in the deformed Al0.1CoCrFeNi HEA. The inset shows an enlarged view of a dislocation node. (b) HRTEM image of partial dislocations with a dominant screw component on {111} planes, a resprenentative dissociated dislocation with the combined screw nature is shown in the inset image.

Atomic structure of a dissociated dislocation. (a) HAADF-STEM image of a 60° full dislocation with a widely dissociated dislocation core; (b) the stacking fault taken from the middle part of the dissociated dislocation; and (c) one end of the extended core with a Shockley partial dislocation.

Estimation of stacking fault energy of the Al0.1CoCrFeNi HEA. Measured dislocation core widths by the two beam STEM and HRTEM/HRSTEM are plotted as a function of dislocation character angle. The measured SFE is 6–21 mJ/m2.

Atomic structure of Lomer locks and Lomer-Cottrell locks formed by dislocation reactions in the deformed HEA. (a) HAADF-STEM image of a Lomer lock formed by the reaction of two full dislocations. (b) The strain mappings around the core of the Lomer lock. (c) HAADF image of a Lomer-Cottrell lock formed by the reaction of two Schockley partial dislocations residing on two different {111} slip planes.
